definition: to keep something as it is, especially to prevent it from decaying or being damaged
example: I need to get out of the house from time to time just to preserve my sanity.

definition: to very much respect and admire someone or something
example: Nelson Mandela is revered for his brave fight against apartheid.

definition: a long search for something difficult to find, or an attempt to achieve something difficult
example: She does aerobics four times a week in her quest to achieve the perfect body.

definition: carrying or holding a lot of something
example: He always comes back from France laden with presents for everyone.

definition: to give a particular job, duty, right, etc. to someone else so that they do it for you
example: As a boss you have to delegate responsibilities to your staff.

definition: relating to a way of speaking or writing that makes someone or something sound bigger, better, more, etc., than they are
example: It was not a hyperbolic expression to call it the worst storm in twenty years.

meaning_cn: 体贴的，体谅的，考虑周到的
definition: careful not to cause inconvenience or hurt to others
example: Motorists should be aware of cyclists and considerate towards them.

meaning_cn: 相当大的，相当多的，相当重要的
definition: notably large in size, amount, or extent
example: The fire caused considerable damage to the church.

meaning_cn: （岩石或其他材料）有孔的，多孔的
definition: having minute interstices through which liquid or air may pass
example: He added sand to the soil to make it more porous.

definition: a specified role or position
example: She was speaking in her capacity as a novelist, rather than as a television presenter.

definition: done or shown openly; plainly or readily apparent, not secret or hidden
example: He shows no overt signs of his unhappiness.

definition: in disagreement
example: His behavior is clearly at odds with what the college expects from its students.

definition: to be different from the usual or expected way of doing or thinking about something
example: At this point in the speech, the minister departed from his prepared text.

definition: in combination with; together with
example: The medicine is typically used in conjunction with other treatments.

definition: to move smoothly and quietly, especially as though it takes no effort
example: Swans went gliding past.

definition: to spend the winter in a state like deep sleep
example: Dormice hibernate from October to May.

definition: any plant without leaves, flowers or green colouring, usually growing on other plants or on decaying matter
example: A fungus is a plant that has no flowers, leaves, or green colouring, such as a mushroom or a toadstool.

definition: a piece of land almost surrounded by water or projecting out into a body of water
example: The Arab live on the Arabian Peninsula.

definition: to make yourself responsible for something and start doing it
example: The company has announced that it will undertake a full investigation into the accident.

definition: to improve or increase something
example: I tried to boost his ego by praising his cooking.

definition: done with or employing great care and thoroughness
example: It took months of painstaking research to write the book.

definition: to make it difficult for someone to do something or for something to develop
example: Their journey was hindered by snow and high winds.

definition: add an extra element or amount to
example: She took the job to supplement her husband's income.

definition: possible to do
example: This plan for a new town library is not economically feasible.

definition: known and praised by many people
example: He is one of today's most celebrated young writers.

definition: having or showing a keen interest in or enthusiasm for something
example: She took an avid interest in the project.

definition: at right angles to a horizontal plane
example: She looked over the cliff and found she was standing at the edge of a vertical drop.

definition: parallel to the plane of the horizon
example: Keep the patient horizontal with the feet slightly raised.

meaning_cn: （价值、数量、功能、意义等）等同的
definition: equal in value, amount, function, meaning, etc.
example: Those less-known companies manufacture equivalent products at cheaper prices.

meaning_cn: 充满，弥漫（某种特质）；引起共鸣
definition: 1. to be filled with a particular quality; 2. If an experience or memory resonates, it makes you think of another similar one.
example: Her experiences resonate powerfully with me, living, as I do, in a similar family situation.

definition: to use information or your knowledge of something to help you do something
example: His novels draw heavily on his childhood.

meaning_cn: 难以居住的，条件恶劣的
definition: not suitable for humans to live in
example: They had to trek for miles through inhospitable countryside.

definition: developing quickly
example: The company hoped to profit from the burgeoning communications industry.

definition: to join or become combined
example: Genes determine how we develop from the moment the sperm fuses with the egg.

definition: to fill someone or something with an emotion or quality
example: The pulling down of the Berlin Wall infused the world with optimism.

meaning_cn: 有弹性的，有复原力的，适应性强的
definition: able to quickly return to a previous good condition
example: She's a resilient girl - she won't be unhappy for long.

definition: difficult or not suitable for living or growing
example: Sales increased last year despite the hostile economic environment.

definition: to fill something up again
example: Food stocks were replenished by imports from abroad.

definition: the act of covering something to stop heat, sound, or electricity from escaping or entering
example: The animal's thick fur provides very good insulation against the arctic cold.

definition: to encourage an activity or development or make it happen faster
example: Rising consumer sales have the effect of spurring the economy to faster growth.

meaning_cn: 养育，抚养，饲养；后面的，后部的
definition: 1. to care for young animals or children until they are able to care for themselves; 2. at or near the back of something
example: He describes how these birds rear their young.

definition: an arrival or entry of large numbers of people or things
example: Turkey is expecting an influx of several thousand refugees over the next few days.

definition: urgent, requiring quick or immediate action or attention
example: Inflation was the most pressing problem.

meaning_cn: 使（形态、性质、功能）转变，改变
definition: cause to change in form, character, or function
example: Could we convert the small bedroom into a second bathroom?
